SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.steelypip.powerups.minxml
Interface MinXML

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<MinXML>, java.lang.Iterable<MinXML>, java.util.List<MinXML>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsFlexiMinXML, AbsMinXML, FlexiMinXML
public interface MinXML
extends java.util.List<MinXML>

MinXML is a cleaner, leaner, cut-down version of XML with only the absolute essentials. An MinXML object is a single element that represents a tree of attributed labels. The MinXML interface defines a standard interface for all classes representing MinXML elements.

Author:
Stephen Leach

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of a MinXML element. It is not guaranteed that this is interned but it is guaranteed to be non-null.

Returns:
the element name

hasName

boolean hasName(java.lang.String name)
Returns true if the name of the element is the same as given string. Equivalent to this.getName() == name.

Parameters:
name - the name we are checking
Returns:
true if the element has that name

setName

void setName(java.lang.String name)
             throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Changes the name of the element to the given string. Note that an implementation of MinXML is not obliged to support this method and may throw an exception. The name may not be null, otherwise a {link RuntimeException} is thrown.

Parameters:
name - the name we are setting
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

getAttribute

java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String key)
Gets the attribute value associated with a given key. If the element does not have an attribute of that name it returns null.

Parameters:
key - the attribute key being looked up
Returns:
the associated value or null

getAttribute

java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.String value_otherwise)
Gets the attribute value associated with a given key. If the element does not have an attribute of that name it returns the suppiled value_otherwise.

Parameters:
key - the attribute key being looked up
value_otherwise - the value to be returned if there is no matching attribute
Returns:
the associated value

hasAttribute

boolean hasAttribute()
Returns true if the element has any attributes, otherwise false.

Returns:
true if the element has 0 or more attributes.

hasAttribute

boolean hasAttribute(java.lang.String key)
Returns true if the element has an attribute with the given key.

Parameters:
key - the attribute key
Returns:
true if the element has an attribute with that key

hasAttribute

boolean hasAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.String value)
Returns true if the element has an attribute with the given key whose value is equal to the given value.

Parameters:
key - attribute being checked
value - value being checked
Returns:
true if the element has a matching attribute

hasntAttribute

boolean hasntAttribute()
Returns true if the element has no attributes, otherwise false.

Returns:
has no attributes

sizeAttributes

int sizeAttributes()
Returns the number of attributes of the element. This is guranteed to be non-negative. If there are more attributes than can be represented by a Java int, then a RuntimeException must be raised.

Returns:
number of attributes.

keys

java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> keys()
Returns a iterator for the set of keys of the attributes of an element.

Returns:
iterator over keys

entries

java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> entries()
Returns a iterator over the attributes of an element, as if the attributes were implemented as a Map.

Returns:
iterator over entries

getAttributes

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAttributes()
Returns a Map representing the attributes of an element. It is guaranteed that the map is safe to read but not to update. Nor is it guaranteed that the map shares updates with the originating element.

Returns:
map of attributes

putAttribute

void putAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.String value)
                  throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Puts an attribute key=value into the element. If no attribute of that key already exists then one is created. Otherwise the value will be changed. A class implementing MinXML is not obliged to implement putAttribute and may throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

Parameters:
key - the attribute key
value - the attribute value
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the implementing class cannot support this method

putAllAttributes

void putAllAttributes(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map)
                      throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

clearAttributes

void clearAttributes()
                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Removes all the attributes of the element. A class implementing MinXML is not obliged to implement clearAttributes and may throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

trimToSize

void trimToSize()
This method signals that there will be no further updates to an element, at least for a while, and the implementation should consider this a good opportunity to compact the space used by this element and all child elements, including any shared elements. Implementations must be clear on whether any subsequent updates are allowed or forbidden. If subsequent updates are forbidden, the implementation must throw an IllegalStateException.

isntEmpty

boolean isntEmpty()
Returns true if the element has no children. It is the opposite of isEmpty().

Returns:
has no children

equals

boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Specified by:

Specified by:

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object

print

void print(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Renders the element using the supplied PrintWriter. The rendering will not contain any newlines. This is the same as the string generated by toString().

Parameters:
pw - the PrintWriter to use.

print

void print(java.io.Writer w)
Renders the element to the supplied Writer.

Parameters:
w - the Writer to use.

prettyPrint

void prettyPrint(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Renders the element using the supplied PrintWriter such that each start and end tag are on their own line and the children indented. The output always finishes with a newline.

Parameters:
pw - the PrintWriter to use.

prettyPrint

void prettyPrint(java.io.Writer w)
Renders the element using the supplied Writer such that each start and end tag are on their own line and the children indented. The output always finishes with a newline.

Parameters:
pw - the Writer to use.

search

boolean search(MinXMLSearcher searcher)
The search method is used to implement basic recursive scans over a tree of elements. It is typically used to search a tree or to implement a series of in-place updates.

Parameters:
searcher -
Returns:
true indicates the search was successful.

walk

void walk(MinXMLWalker walker)
The walk method is used to implement a recursive scan over a tree. It is much the same as search but with no early exits.

Parameters:
visitor -

shallowCopy

MinXML shallowCopy()
shallowCopy makes a copy of the topmost node but shares the children. The implementation of the new node must be at least as general as the implementation of this node i.e. implement all the methods that do not raise UnsupportedOperationException

deepCopy

MinXML deepCopy()
deepCopy makes a copy of the topmost node and all the children. The implementation of the new nodes must be at least as general as the implementation of this node i.e. implement all the methods that do not raise UnsupportedOperationException
